thread.title: Matchup: San Jose State vs. San Diego State
thread.title_full: Matchup: San Jose State vs. San Diego State

author:
Jeff Faraudo

jfaraudo@bayareanewsgroup.com
title: Matchup: San Jose State vs. San Diego State
text:
Matchup: San Jose State vs. San Diego State By Jeff Faraudo Posted: 10/16/2015 11:05:07 AM PDT Updated: 10/16/2015 11:37:57 AM PDT SpartanCentral blog SAN JOSE STATE VS. SAN DIEGO STATE RECORDS: San Jose State is 3-3, 2-1 in Mountain West; San Diego State is 3-3, 2-0 in Mountain West. 
KICKOFF: Saturday, 7:30 p.m. at Spartan Stadium in San Jose. 
TV/RADIO: ESPNU/1590-AM. 
SERIES HISTORY: San Jose State leads 19-17-2. San Diego State Cal leads 5-4. San Diego State won 38-7 in the most recent meeting in 2014. The Spartans have not beaten SDSU in San Jose since a 35-10 win in 2008. San Jose State running back Tyler Ervin (7) breaks a tackle attempt by UNLV defensive back Torry McTyer (4) during the second half of an NCAA college football game Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015, in Las Vegas. San Jose State won 33-27. (AP Photo/John Locher) ( John Locher ) 
STORYLINES: The winner will have sole possession of first place in the West Division of the Mountain West Conference. SDSU is the defending West Division co-champ. . . . This game begins a string of three straight at home for the Spartans, who play New Mexico a week from Saturday and face BYU on Friday, Nov. 6. . . Four Aztecs players — offensive lineman Darrell Greene, linebacker Fred Melifonwu and special teams players Blly Vaughn Jr., and Derek Babiash — were reinstated this week after six-game suspensions for violation of team rules, the San Diego Union-Tribune reported. It's unknown how much they will play against SJSU. 
INJURY UPDATE: San Jose State: RB Thomas Tucker (ankle) is out; LB Christian Tago (foot) will play; San Diego State: DE Dakota Turner (knee) and LB Randy Ricks (toe) are out. Advertisement 
MATCHUP TO WATCH: San Diego State's Rashaad Penny vs. San Jose State's kickoff coverage team. Penny, a sophomore running back, is second nationally in kickoff return average at 37.5 yards — two of them for touchdowns, including a 100-yarder vs. Penn State. The Spartans rank last in the MWC in kickoff coverage and have allowed 29.3 yards per return. 
STATS THAT MATTER: The Spartans are fourth in the MWC in scoring (30.5 ppg) and the Aztecs are fourth in scoring defense (21.7). . . SJSU senior running back Tyler Ervin, averaging 145.7 rushing yards per game, needs just 126 yards to become the fourth MWC player to reach 1,000 yards in his seventh game. . . . SJSU leads the MWC in third-down conversions (45.5 percent) but SDSU is second in third-down defense (27.0 percent). -- JEFF FARAUDO
